title: Thunderbird levelező riporttolási lehetőség létezik?
content:
Kedves Support team, Szükségem van a beérkező emailek adatának tömeges kigyűjtésére xls.-be. Ehhez keresek megoldást. Amire szükségem van: 

- Feladó email címe

- Email tárgya - Email dátuma

Van lehetőség ezeket az adatokat valahogyan tömegesen kinyerni a levelező rendszerből. Munkafolyamat kidolgozásához van szükség erre az adatra.

Köszönöm válaszotokat! Üdvözlettel, Pap Csilla
creator: sz.csorike

title: lokale mappen verdwenen na update
content:
Sinds eergisteren ben ik na de update van Thunderbird, al mijn lokale (privé) mappen (en dus ook al mijn gearchiveerde mail) kwijt, of ik zie ze niet meer. De mogelijkheid om de mappenvensterwerkbalk via Menu - Beeld - Werkbalken, zichtbaar te krijgen ontbreekt bij mij ook (zie schermafdruk). De enige mappen die ik nu nog heb onder lokale mappen zijn Prullenbak en Postvak UIT.

ik heb al geprobeerd om via profielbeheer een eerdere profielmap te gebruiken maar dit heeft niet het gewenste resultaat Heeft u enig idee hoe ik al mijn privé mappen (en mail) weer terug kan krijgen?

Mvg, Ronald en Els
creator: de-jonge-boel

title: Resizing images in TB
content: I have installed the add-on Shrunked Image Resizer 5.1. However, when I use it, the quality of the reduced image is often very poor. I can get a much higher quality resized image by dragging the lower right corner of the image upwards and towards the left. However, this is a bit tedious, as I may have to do this 2-3 times to get the image to a smaller size, particularly if the original image is very large. Anyone know any easier way to resize images without losing so much quality?
creator: queenmab100

title: How do I completely remove Thunderbird? I can't find directions to fix it.
content:
How do I completely remove every element of Thunderbird so when I reinstall it has not saved any of my previous information?

I moved my email to a new server and when I did I was forced to change the password. No matter what I do, I canNot get Thunderbird to constantly use the new password. And my new server won't accept the Old password. Worse yet, when Thunderbird opens, it uses the Old password to attempt to log in which causes the servers firewall to block me from my server and all my websites.

I uninstalled Thunderbird, but when I reinstall it, it Automatically install the email address again with all the same issue.

I have followed all the directions I can find - It's not working. I have gone to More Trouble Shooting Options, I've deleted the files, I've unchecked Read Only, I've done everything I can find - nothing is working.

PLEASE - How do I completely remove every element of Thunderbird so when I reinstall it has not saved any of my previous information?
creator: StuckAtHomeMom

title: The application/octet-stream image problem has returned in latest release
content:
The application/octet-stream issue has returned with the latest revision of Thunderbird. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=444759

We are testing sending and receiving newsletters with all the different email clients. With the latest revision of Thunderbird we have seen that when emails are received that have been sent using the Amazon SES service Thunderbird is not handling the images properly. It is not identifying the content type as image/jpeg and therefore is not displaying any images in the email.

The images are being seen by Thunderbird like this: Content-Type: application/octet-stream; name="attachmentimg1244" Content-Disposition: inline; filename="attachmentimg1244" Content-ID: <img1244> Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64

If it instead looks like this then it works ok: Content-Type: image/jpeg; name=attachmentimg6599 Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64 Content-ID: <img6599> Content-Disposition: inline; filename=attachmentimg6599

Every other email client we have tested is displaying the images properly. Outlook, gmail, yahoo, safari, iphones, androids all work ok. This problem is unique to Thunderbird.

From the link I included above it looks like there was a patch to correct this issue. Any ideas how to get it implemented into the next Thunderbird release so it can identify an image as an image and read emails received from the Amazon SES servers?
creator: l15

title: wrong correspondents address
content:

Also when I sent an email from an account to the account itself, the correspondents address takes the character exactly (capitals) as written in the receiver address.

Is this normal?
creator: louis14

title: How can I remove reverse highlighting from Subject line in Thunderbird client
content:
In Thunderbird 107.2.1, when I view an email I have received, the Subject line is now rendered as a "knock-out" (or "reverse"), i.e., a boldface font printed in white against a colored background. When I first view an email, the Subject line is rendered in white on a red-orange background. Once I have viewed the email, the Subject line is rendered in white on a grey background. (See attachments.)

I find this hard-to-read and annoying. I want to be able to have the Subject line rendered as it was previously, i.e., a boldface font in black against the overall grey background. The knock-out effect is harder for older people to read. This feature ought to be user-configurable. Please tell me how I can eliminate the knock-out and return to the rendering I have used for eighteen years.
creator: jkeenan1

title: I get hundreds of repeated messages periodically in the inbox
content: I have now (5 times - twice recently) received hundreds of recently received messages in my inbox again. The symptoms are these. These messages are not distributed according to the message rules, but are left in the inbox. At least one of the times, I looked on the message server just hours before the issue and the mail box on the server was empty, definitely did not have days worth of emails. I am using POP3, with messages NOT left on the server. I have tried to compact the inbox just after I delete the extra messages, but it happened a few days later again (did not keep times of compacting, so unsure if all the next batch were after the compaction). Any clues as to where and how to begin searching for a solution? And yes, I update whenever the software offers it. Thanks much, Charles
creator: charles111

title: Spoof email return addresses
content:
I did a search here but didn't really find an answer - so here goes...

Emails usually come with a return address for replies - but scam emails tend to use a false return address (sometimes even the same address as the recipient!!) Is it possible for Thunderbird to show the sender's actual address? i.e. where the reply would go if I did reply?

The reason I'm asking is that I've started getting emails purporting to come from a couple of elderly neighbours when in fact they aren't actually from them.
